New Records: Travis Head smashed his 50 off just 19 balls to set a new Australian record against England in T20 internationals.
Key Match Events: Travis Head scored 59 off 23 balls, including the fastest ever T20I half-century by an Australian batter against England.
Adam Zampa took 2-20 as Australia's bowlers got England all out 29 runs short of victory.
Josh Hazlewood took the key wicket of Liam Livingstone, bowling him off an inside edge when the big-hitting all-rounder had been on 37 off 27 balls.
Sean Abbott impressed with his 3-28 off 3.2 overs.
Tim David made an astonishing running catch off Bartlett at deep mid-on to get rid of Jordan Cox.
Post-Match Reflections: Mitch Marsh hailed the 'special' talent of Travis Head, Adam Zampa, and Josh Hazlewood.
Marsh commented on the importance of having experienced players like Hazlewood for the young guys in the team.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played at the Rose Bowl in Southampton.
Phil Salt was the stand-in captain for England, replacing the injured Jos Buttler.
Australia drew first blood in the three-match T20 series which continues in Cardiff on Saturday morning (AEST).
